value.name: AnalyzeServiceNowIncidents
value.description: Analyze or summarize one or many ServiceNow incidents based on an optional incident number, optional keyword, incident state, incident priority, date range, and the user's query or desired analysis.
value.descriptionForModel: Analyze or summarize one or many ServiceNow incidents based on an optional incident number, optional keyword, incident state, incident priority, date range, and the user's query or desired analysis.
examplePrompts: Find common patterns among these ServiceNow incidents
Analyze ServiceNow incident INC0000010 and provide an executive summary
Analyze ServiceNow incidents INC0000010,INC0000011 and provide an executive summary

inputs.placeholderValue: User query to use in incident summarization
inputs.name: SummarizationQuery
inputs.description: User query to use in incident summarization.

inputs.name: IncidentNumbers
inputs.description: Incident number(s), usually starts with INC for normal incidents or SIR for security incidents. Examples are INC0010001 and SIR0010001. If the user stated multiple incident numbers, they must be provided in a comma-separated format, such as 'INC0000050,INC0000051'. If the user did not state an incident number, must be set to 'None' or left empty.

inputs.name: Keyword
inputs.description: Keywords to search for in ServiceNow incidents. Must be a single word or a phrase in quotes. Must not contain search filtering information that is better represented by any other parameter (such as incident type, priority, or state). Must be empty if the user did not specify any search terms that are valid keywords.

inputs.name: State
inputs.description: State of the ServiceNow incident, as stated by the user. Example incident states: New, In progress, On hold, Resolved, Closed, Canceled. Other incident states are also possible. If the user did not explicitly ask for a specific incident state, must be Any.

inputs.placeholderValue: Number of incidents to return. Up to 100
inputs.name: IncidentCount
inputs.description: Number of ServiceNow incidents to return. Must be equal to or less than 100

inputs.placeholderValue: Order to sort by. Ascending, Descending
inputs.name: SortBy
inputs.description: Order to sort by, must be one of: Ascending, Descending. Defaults to Descending

inputs.name: Priority
inputs.description: Priority or severity of the incident, as stated by the user. Example incident priorities: Critical, High, Moderate, Medium, Low, Planning. Other incident priorities/severities are also possible. If the user did not explicitly ask for a specific incident severity or priority, must be Any.

inputs.placeholderValue: Incident type. Must be one of: INC, SIR; will fallback to Default Incident Type
inputs.name: IncidentType
inputs.description: Type of incident, case, or ticket to search for. Must be one of: INC, SIR. If the user does not not provide or imply an incident type, parameter **must** be left blank. Choose SIR if the user specifically requests incidents, tickets, or cases involving 'SIR', 'security', or 'SOC' . Choose INC if the user specifically requests incidents, tickets, or cases involving 'INC', 'ITSM', 'regular', or 'IT'.

inputs.placeholderValue: Created after date in UTC date time OR relative time from current date in hours (h), days (d), weeks (w), or months (m) (e.g. 20h, 2d)
inputs.name: CreatedAfter
inputs.description: Beginning of time range to search incidents in. Must be stated in UTC and formatted like '2023-11-14 20:13:02'. Defaults to 14 days if no date is provided.

inputs.placeholderValue: Created before date in UTC date time OR relative time from current date in hours (h), days (d), weeks (w), or months (m) (e.g. 20h, 2d)
inputs.name: CreatedBefore
inputs.description: End of time range to search incidents in. Must be stated in UTC and formatted like '2023-11-14 20:13:02'. Must be omitted if the user does not request a time range.

inputs.name: Resolution
inputs.description: Resolution or closure state of incidents. Example resolutions: 'Confirmed - True Positive', 'Merged', 'Non-applicable event' and 'Duplicate'. If the user stated multiple resolutions, they must be provided in a comma-separated format

inputs.name: AssignmentGroup
inputs.description: Assignment group of incidents

inputs.placeholderValue: Assigned to user(s). Use full names, 'me', or 'myself'
inputs.name: Owner
inputs.description: Full name of the incident owner, including both the first and last names. User can provide special words like 'me' and 'myself' instead of the fullname.

inputs.placeholderValue: Closed after date in UTC date time OR relative time from current date in hours (h), days (d), weeks (w), or months (m) (e.g. 20h, 2d)
inputs.name: ClosedAfter
inputs.description: Beginning of time range to search incidents on by closed date. Must be stated in UTC and formatted like '2023-11-14 20:13:02'. Must be omitted if the user does not request a time range.

inputs.placeholderValue: Closed before date in UTC date time OR relative time from current date in hours (h), days (d), weeks (w), or months (m) (e.g. 20h, 2d)
inputs.name: ClosedBefore
inputs.description: End of time range to search incidents on closed date. Must be stated in UTC and formatted like '2023-11-14 20:13:02'. Must be omitted if the user does not request a time range.

inputs.name: AlertLink
inputs.description: Alert or Alert link of incidents.

inputs.name: Substate
inputs.description: Sub state or substate of incidents. Example sub states: 'Email response received', 'Testing' and 'Out of Scope'

inputs.name: AdditionalSummarizationInstructions
inputs.description: Additional incident summarization instructions. **Must** be left empty unless the user specifically and explicitly mentions 'additional summarization instructions'.

inputs.placeholderValue: Extra custom columns to be used in analysis (e.g. u_subject_s_country, u_related_case, mitre_group)
inputs.name: IncidentFieldSystemNames
inputs.description: Extra custom column names from the ServiceNow incident table to use in analysis. Comma separated, multiple values. Example field system names: u_subject_s_country, u_related_case, mitre_group. Field names must be explicitly provided by the user as 'custom field names', otherwise this input must be left as 'None'.

value.name: AppendCommentToServiceNowIncident
value.description: Appends / adds comment to a specific ServiceNow Incident
value.descriptionForModel: Appends / adds comment to a specific ServiceNow Incident
examplePrompts: Add a comment to the ServiceNow incident
Append a comment to the ServiceNow incident
Add a session sharing link to the ServiceNow incident
Add a summary of this session to the ServiceNow incident

inputs.name: CommentText
inputs.description: Text of the comment to add to ServiceNow incident

inputs.name: IncidentNumber
inputs.description: Incident number, usually starts with INC for normal incidents or SIR for security incidents. Examples are INC0010001 and SIR0010001

inputs.name: SysId
inputs.description: Unique ServiceNow identifier / system id / sys id of the incident. Example one is 1c741bd70b2322007518478d83673af3

inputs.placeholderValue: Override comment text with sharing link? True, False
inputs.name: SessionSharingLink
inputs.description: Indicates whether user wants to include a session sharing link in the comment

inputs.placeholderValue: Override comment text to use a generated summary? True, False
inputs.name: SummarizeInvestigation
inputs.description: Indicates whether user wants to include a summary of the investigation / session in the comment

inputs.placeholderValue: Incident type. Must be one of: INC, SIR; will fallback to Default Incident Type
inputs.name: IncidentType
inputs.description: Type of incident, case, or ticket to search for. Must be one of: INC, SIR. If the user does not not provide or imply an incident type, parameter **must** be left blank. Choose SIR if the user specifically requests incidents, tickets, or cases involving 'SIR', 'security', or 'SOC' . Choose INC if the user specifically requests incidents, tickets, or cases involving 'INC', 'ITSM', 'regular', or 'IT'.

value.name: GetServiceNowIncident
value.description: Get detailed information about a ServiceNow Incident such as short description, priority, category, state, configuration item, business service, comments, and worknotes. **Must be used when user asks for both comments AND worknotes for an incident.**
value.descriptionForModel: Get detailed information about a ServiceNow Incident such as short description, priority, category, state, configuration item, business service, comments, and worknotes. **Must be used when user asks for both comments AND worknotes for an incident.**
examplePrompts: Show me details for the ServiceNow incident
Show me comments AND worknotes for the ServiceNow incident
Get details for the ServiceNow incident

inputs.name: IncidentNumber
inputs.description: Incident number, usually starts with INC for normal incidents or SIR for security incidents. Examples are INC0010001 and SIR0010001

inputs.name: SysId
inputs.description: Unique ServiceNow identifier / system id / sys id of the incident. Example one is 1c741bd70b2322007518478d83673af3

inputs.placeholderValue: Columns to display (e.g. Source, Alert Rule, Incident state)
inputs.name: IncidentFieldNames
inputs.description: Column names of the ServiceNow incident table. Usually it is subjects of the question. Example: Source, Alert Rule, Incident state, Business impact, domains, IP's, techniques

value.name: GetServiceNowIncidentComments
value.description: Gets detailed comments for a ServiceNow incident
value.descriptionForModel: Gets detailed comments for a ServiceNow incident
examplePrompts: Show me the 4 most recent comments for ServiceNow incident
Which comments for ServiceNow incident mention file hashes
Show me the comments for ServiceNow incident

inputs.name: IncidentNumber
inputs.description: Incident number, usually starts with INC for normal incidents or SIR for security incidents. Examples are INC0010001 and SIR0010001

inputs.name: SysId
inputs.description: Unique ServiceNow identifier / system id / sys id of the incident. Example one is 1c741bd70b2322007518478d83673af3

value.name: GetServiceNowIncidentWorkNotes
value.description: Gets detailed work notes for a ServiceNow incident
value.descriptionForModel: Gets detailed work notes for a ServiceNow incident
examplePrompts: Show me the 4 most recent worknotes for ServiceNow incident
Which work notes for ServiceNow incident mention file hashes
Show me the worknotes for ServiceNow incident

value.name: SearchServiceNowIncidents
value.description: Searches for ServiceNow incidents based on optional keyword, incident state, and incident priority inputs
value.descriptionForModel: Searches for ServiceNow incidents based on optional keyword, incident state, and incident priority inputs
examplePrompts: Find ServiceNow incidents related to email
Show me ServiceNow cases related to malware
Give me all the critical ServiceNow security incidents

inputs.name: Keyword
inputs.description: Keywords to search for in ServiceNow incidents. Must be a single word or a phrase in quotes. Must not contain search filtering information that is better represented by any other parameter (such as incident type, priority, or state). Must be empty if the user did not specify any search terms that are valid keywords.

inputs.name: State
inputs.description: State of the ServiceNow incident, as stated by the user. Example incident states: New, In progress, On hold, Resolved, Closed, Canceled. Other incident states are also possible. If the user did not explicitly ask for a specific incident state, must be Any.

inputs.placeholderValue: Number of incidents to return. Up to 15, defaults to 10

inputs.description: Number of ServiceNow incidents to return. Must be equal to or less than 15. Default number is 10

inputs.placeholderValue: Order to sort by. Ascending, Descending

Other incident priorities/severities are also possible. If the user did not explicitly ask for a specific incident severity or priority, must be Any.

Choose INC if the user specifically requests incidents, tickets, or cases involving 'INC', 'ITSM', 'regular', or 'IT'.
